ai_sprite.name: alma
ai_sprite.dialog: I gave up the judgment seat so that I can focus my efforts to teaching this people and bringing them to repentance. Nephihah has been chosen by the people as the new chief judge. I'm sorry I can't accompany you into battle anymore. Please see what Nephihah has to say.

dialog.text: Our peace did not last long! The city of Noah is under attack by the Lamanites! You must hurry there and defend it. Noah is nearby to the southeast, by the river.

I am Pahoran, son of Nephihah. My father has died and the people have chosen me to fill the judgment seat in his stead. Now that Amalickiah has been driven out of the land, we need your help in settling a land dispute between the borders of the cities Lehi and Morianton. These cities are to the north of Jershon, by the seashore.

You have stopped Amalickiah from overthrowing the government, but he has fled with some of his men southward, toward the Lamanites. You must intercept him quickly, before the Lamanites gain any more power! Our scouts reported seeing him last south of Manti and Siron, in the forest just east of the land of Nephi.
Well done, Moroni. Perhaps Amalickiah is now ready to join us again. He was last seen at his home in Ammonihah.

The Zoramites in Antionum have broken off from the Nephites. We would leave them alone, but now they are threatening the people in Jershon because they took care of the poor that the Zoramites had cast out. Most people in Jershon took an oath to never fight again. You must defend them! Antionum is northeast of Manti.

I am truly sorry I could not recruit enough soldiers to defend Ammonihah earlier. But Manti to the south is still in danger. Check the area near the city and stop the Lamanite army before they attack Manti. Once they are driven back, report to me.
You must hurry and secure Ammonihah against the Lamanites. Then return and report back.

Good job in liberating the friendly Lamanites. Our people have given up the land of Jershon for our Lamanite friends to inherit. It is east of here beyond the river, but you may have to go a round-about way to get there.

I am the new chief judge Nephihah, chosen by the voice of the people. Moroni, there are many Lamanites beyond the mountain passage south of Minon who wish to defect to the Nephites, but their rulers will not let them. You must go liberate them and find a safe place in Nephite territory to harbor them.

You have done our country a great service, Moroni, by capturing Nehor and bringing him to me. As promised, I am appointing you captain of all the Nephite armies. You may face many challenges, but I can think of no other to best fight our battles and support the cause of liberty.
Moroni, you must bring Nehor to me to face justice. If you do this, I will appoint you as chief captain of our armies.

Moroni, listen! Before our last king, Mosiah, passed away, he established just laws and a government of judges chosen by the people because he didn't want our people in bondage ever again by an evil king. I have been chosen as the first chief judge, and yet we have already seen a faction rise up in rebellion. They are led by a man named Nehor, who has killed an innocent man simply for debating against him and his religion. You must bring order again to the land and capture Nehor so that he can face justice for his crimes. If you do this, I will appoint you as chief captain of our armies.

Don't think that the execution of Nehor will go unnoticed. His followers have already assembled under the leadership of Amlici. We will gain the voice of the people to anoint him as king and do away with the judges. But Moroni, I am not as patient as Amlici. I will avenge Nehor here and now!
